I agree; counter intuitive. What is it your seeking from the wind?; FORCE.
Although the swept area of the thinner blade may be larger, the blade which extracts the force from the wind only comprises roughly 6% of the total swept area at any instant.
Fans used to move air utilize wide blades (60% or more) to exert force over a wider area. Old style windmills use wide blades to extract a high amount of force from the wind.
Since the gearing necessary to achieve the 3600 rpm generator rotation also increases the required torque load to initiate and continue rotation, would it not be more advantageous
to make the blades shorter and wider to collect more torque?
They would not spin as fast due to cavitation and drag, but they would have a significantly higher torque input even in lower wind speeds.
This theory would seem to be proved out in small wind experiments using the thinner blades but varying the number of blades, thereby increasing the surface area contacted by the wind.
A fully loaded 1kW HAWT with three blades begins rotating in a wind of 20 mph.
The same test setup but with 7 of the same blade style begins rotating in a 8 mph wind.
More surface area, the higher the power extraction. In a VAWT, the difference between the Darrius rotor and the Savonius rotor assembly.

You haven't mentioned one important thing. Why all windmills have three blades and not four (respectively smaller ones).

It has to do with the dynamic load when the lowest blade is passing the tower. If four blades are mounted, there is a big force difference when one blade passes the tower or no blade is in front of the tower. The blade on the highest spot creates the biggest force against the tower (due to the bigger leverage) but in the same moment is a blade in front of the tower that creates up to zero force (also due to Betz's law). When the blades are on 45° to the top most position and to the tower, all four blades create force against the tower.

With three blades it's either one blade in front of the tower and two blades in 60° to the top most position or it's two blades in 60° to the tower and one blade in top most position. The difference in force is way smaller this way and the tower can be build much slimmer and so more cost efficient.

That leaves the question, why are three wind blades better than two or four?
It's because of stability and to reduce oscillation of the rotor.
For example if a rotor has two blades one blade will be above and one below.
Now the higher one will experience a higher wind pressure because the wind up there is stronger.
Also the lower one will experience less wind pressure because its lower and because the supporting tower is in the way of the wind.
This leads to strong pulsating forces on the tip of the tower.
If you have three blades instead, everytime one blade points straight upwards, there will be two pointing downwards (as kind of counterweight), decreasing stress on the wind turbine.

【注：此宇宙物质结构的动力能量原理分为上下两篇文章论述，上篇以数理分析论述为主，所以有大量的数学公式和图表在论文中，网络上不能正确传递讯息。所以就不完整上传，只上传“内容提要”之前部分。因为此论文2009年投稿钱学森创办的《中国力学》被建议改投“物理类”而转投杨振宁创办的《中国理论物理》，被杨振宁带领中科院截取剽窃，并用其理论和公式否定“牛顿与爱因斯坦都错得离谱”！可他们不知道该论文2010年被中国科技部科技学术杂志《中国新技术新产品》发表（论文标题被该期刊封面采用。），国内刊号:CN11_5601/T；国际刊号：issn 1673_9957。如果有兴趣可以在网上搜索。其论文的副标题就在提示与牛顿力学及爱因斯坦的相对论，是继续探索、发展中的关系，并不是要去颠覆否定。2015年开始在国际网络上指出杨振宁获诺贝尔奖的论文的虚假成分，及吴健雄为其证明手段做伪。2017年杨振宁弃美投中，否定美国教育及基础科学都落后中国！当我提出在我的个人网页上有科学论文理论、证据、资料可以充分证明其抢劫、剽窃时，就将我的国际网络上的个人网页、个人邮箱、云端资料的账户和密码全部封锁。甚至连网上“评论”功能都被取消（直到九个月后的2020年1月我从国内回到居住国后，才唯一开放了我在国际网上的部分评论权限及部分网页功能。）。当然杨振宁是东西方共同最高文明的代表，在国际网络上受到如此地保护，是不应该只局限在哪一方的。2019年12月上旬我在国内与曾经发表了上篇的出版社联系出版下篇一事，被告之：再不能在国家级刊物发表，在取消英文标题、内容提要、关键词，删除论文后面的“说明”并必须注明作者所在单位后，可以在省市级刊物上发表。在此上传其完整的下篇、是在上篇的数理理论的基础上，从最微观世界到最宏观世界，论述宇宙及所有物质全都是由不可消灭，也不可创造的电子、质子、中子三种永恒地最基本物质的性质和相互作用变化所组成的各种物理层级与各种变化现象。所以宇宙自然当然就是永恒存在的，不断变化的只是这三种基本物质在其中的各物理层级地排列组合。当然在我这个网页上的其它文章中还有一些论述涉及到，但是更大量的证明资料、图片、文章现在还是不让上传的。即使以前成功上传的小部分也是被网络封锁删除了的。
引发这两篇论文是因为中国电力机车科研制造系统在上世纪八十年代末引进、仿造并声明也达到了国际先进科技水平的机车，在应用中动力系统却出现严重、研制方始终无法解决的问题。直到严重干扰铁路运输秩序与能力时才邀请我跨界（时值2002年底，已从科技口转向技术质量监督多年）查找处理。2003年初我就检查分析出（技术科有一专业工程师配合做测试）：该型机车动力源原理设计错误、使用理论落后、应用技术指标倒退。并提出“脉流恒功率动力理论与技术”，将全面论述文章投给株洲电力机车研究所并通告刘友梅院士；同时申报郑州铁路局机车验收质量奖，被推荐到获铁道部机车质量优秀奖；向所在单位申请每台机车十万元、一年完成，可使机车节省能源百分之五十以上；或增加牵引力一倍；或提高机车运行速度一倍。三年再完成更大科技效益提升地创新研制。全被搁置不理，只好在04年以郑州局派驻部门身份申请郑州局05年科技立项，却引起了05年初“武汉铁路局从郑州局独立出”，也要完成对这项科技创新地全面阻击的大动作。只得为“科技强国献计献策”向铁道部、科技部、国务院、中国工程院、、、投递资料信息。都说：牵涉到院士，超出权限管不了。国务院推给中纪委，中纪委又推回国务院。此时胡锦涛就提出了“与伪科学和谐的社会发展观”，国家08年也就声明：已于05年就全部淘汰担当中国最主要的ss4-9六种主型、2000多台、国际先进的客货运机车。其中吹得最响的ss8型研制出才两三年、ss9型研制出才一年多。为了鬼魅般的面子，就一定让这上千亿的人民血汗钱如此打水漂？也不敢让我改装一台试验！更不惜暴露颠覆其邪恶统治制度？
以上两篇基础科学论文是产生于之前探索发现国际国内机电动力理论基础缺陷后地提升。
从1980年就专职负责机车动力无极调速试验（首创数字自动化在机车上使用，无极控制机车动力调整。），解决了众多科技问题并取得了唯一成功，被铁道部全路机车推广采用。从此开始30多年不间断地对机电动力恒功率研究。其论文“东风4型机车无极调速结构、原理及应用”就提出了实现将牵引动力“软化”向“恒功率化”的科技手段。其论文投稿《内燃机车》杂志，因与主要负责人学术流派不同，被搁置了11年，于1996年他临退休前才得以该杂志发表。
“对国产电力机车设计缺陷的发现、研究与探讨”（实际进口的二、三代电力机车也存在同样类似的问题）、2003年投稿《机车电传动》遭封杀。院士答应了给发表而又不让发表。2012年9年后才由非铁道动力专业的中国技术经济研究会价值工程委员会会刊《价值工程》发表。
“能量有效利用、恒功率理论概率”、2004年再遭《机车电传动》封杀、同年科技部调解无效。但参加了国庆56周年庆典入编《国庆文献集》。提出了最先进的动力能效理论。
“脉流恒功率理论的应用技术实现”、2007年中国科协年会宣讲（邓楠组持、俞正声到会、近百院士、全国各路7000科技精英参加。）、并提出请杨振宁与有关专家审查，我随时答辩。也作为会议反馈表向会务递交。被《科技咨询导报》发表，其标题被该集刊面采用。（中国航天科技集团主管、中国宇航出版社）。

动力能量学基础理论的提出及应用原理示意（上篇大标题）
（动力学基础理论的集合及牛顿力学定律的定位与“能量守恒”、“相对论”的关系）（上篇小标题）
中国湖北武汉 李辉林
内容提要：牛顿力学诞生于300年前现代工业的萌芽期，所研究的对象基本上以重力、爆炸力或弹道力为主。工业科学发展到今天，牛顿力学作为动力学的基础也应该随着动力发展而发展，要能够对所有动力（包括人为动力）现象有一个统一完善的理论体系。如：机电动力、热动力、流体动力等，已经是人类生存环境无处不在的重要部分，但用经典的牛顿力学来完整地解释它们却存在一些问题。最根本的原因是经典力学是以常规一次性施力为研究对象，现代力学要面对的多是持续性施力的情况，而光电动因、宇宙大爆炸论的出现更需要统一的理论。论文要解决的是经典动力学与现代动力学共同的“动力微分关系”，和“变量到常量”“量变到质变”的不同关系；特别是人造动力装置往往是将动力与运动体做成一体，就容易混淆质量m与作用力F的主从关系a、功能关系Nt、表里状态V。将牛顿定律各自准确地定位于动力学系统中，从而实现了经典力学与现代动力学的统一，包括与“相对论”的通解。同时也揭示了持续动力在变量与常量的交替中，可以主动地获取更大的做功能力和更多的能量利用效率。这也解决了一些动力学应用中的一些困惑和五花八门的做法。

As a wind turbine design engineer, I understand why you call them windmills even though they are wind turbines, but it still bothers me a bit ;)
Regarding size and speed, in practice and as a general rule, the bigger the rotor the slower it spins. Even though wind turbines are designed to maximise power they also have to follow strict rules such as noise limits. If you imagine 2 wind turbines, one big and one small, spinning at the same angular velocity, the tip speed of the bigger blade is going way faster that the small one. This can make a lot of noise and if you account that it ca also get in the range of supersonic speeds then a lot of other problems might come (ex: aerodynamics change, more vibrations inducing fatigue and lower component life etc).

2:00 the Vortex behind the mill is the result of force that turned it. Less vortex = less power no matter how you put it. The efficiency does not even go into the equation.
Think of it - perfect 100% efficient windmill that will not rotate the air behind it and wont slow it down... sooo it's as if the mill wasn't there at all. So no power can be extracted.

It's actually the same with aircraft, the induced drag (vortex behind wingtips) is not really a "drag" - it is what created the lift! Thats why we don't see any special "devices" that reduce induced drag on the wings*. Any attempts at reducing vortex will reduce lift, and efficiency comes only by smoothing out vortex creation so less energy is spent on turbulence, and more on spinning.
* - winglets don't count as they are basically wingspan extenders without actually making the aircraft physically wider, and they don't try to reduce the vortex.

Betz's law also has not much on blade area. If it were, airliner engines would not be able to pass any air into the engine.

The blades do not turn that fast.  They are designed so that as the wind blows faster or slower the blades change their pitch to reduce or increase wind pressure so they can stay in a specific speed range.  The blades are designed to generate a torque within a certain range in order to maintain the generator speed.  It is torque and efficiency, not speed, that determined the bade design.  More blades does not add enough to make them worth the cost and wider blades makes it harder to maintain their speed to obtain the ideal torque for the generator and subjects them to excess stress from higher winds.

The problem with this video is in it's very first premise. Wind mills simply cannot do the job of combating climate change and there's no theoretical way for them to EVER have that capability. This is in fact the total consensus of science that no one likes to talk about as we've all been bamboozled by the renewable energy sales pitch deeply steeped in the naturalism fallacy. Renewable energy is really a quite terrible idea on it's own merits or lack thereof, but it's never examined in the popular press or even scientific literature. That's why there are exactly ZERO quality studies showing that large scale renewable energy for the entire world is even possible, much less practical. Really none at all and that's before tackling the larger more complex question of if it helps with climate change. Which is all a rather bewildering oversight considering how much this 'goal' influences public policy.

The most commonly cited incorrect example is Mark Z. Jacobson's 'Solutions Project'. It's been comically debunked many times most comprehensively here https://www.roadmaptonowhere.com, but also in this more formal scientific form, which was the subject of hilarious nuisance lawsuit since Jacobson couldn't be bothered to defend his views with science. https://www.pnas.org/content/114/26/6722

But really it's not a mystery once one understands how energy works. Wind and solar are fundamentally terrible energy sources while the other popular renewables are far too limited in scale; and all of them are deeply destructive to the environment as they use up far too much land and natural resources in their construction and operation. Both are unavoidable factors as they're so deeply inefficient. They will simply never work for general use, and the big goal of 100% renewable power is just flatly impossible. Proponents of the renewable dream don't even try to hide it, they just keep asking for more research and more study. Implying that the "kinks" will be worked out... But in reality they're hard physical limits intrinsic to the concept, that's why renewable power is just modern day alchemy.

The list of insurmountable flaws is really quite long, and it only takes a single one to scuttle the whole idea.

-No system exists to ensure grid reliability, particularly with regards to frequency stability, in fact wind and solar drastically worsen reliability which is the paramount requirement of any energy system.
-Renewable power is seriously geographically limited, much of the world just doesn't have that geography.
-Long transmission lines to cross connect areas with different generation and demand are all but impossible to build due to right of way and environmental laws.
-Large storage is at best infeasible and even if it could work it only adds more cost and reduces the overall efficiency of the power system straining generation capacity that renewable power already can't meet.
-There's no renewable solution to many types of energy demand, the fixation of electricity alone leaves out over half of our energy consumption. The idea of electrifying energy thing is both impossible and ignores the fact that we're never going to have enough wind and solar to meet our electricity demands, so trying for 2-3 times the current level is absurd.
-The land use requirements and raw material requirements of wind and solar power is tragic. Not only do these resources not exist, but it's cause environmental havoc to try and obtain them.
-The short life span of renewable power installations at less than half conventional generators (and that's an ideal comparison) greatly worsens all the other factors.

And this isn't even everything, just a few big obvious ones. That's why the future, and especially are carbon free future is nuclear powered. End of, the only thing that's debatable with so called renewable energy is how long we suffer before abandoning the idea.

A fundamental problem with wind generation is that they always run at maximum power dependant on available wind (That in itself brings another problem, wind speed to power output is a cube law so small variations in wind speed means a large variation in power, far from ideal).
As grid demand is variable wind is unable to respond to that rise and fall in demand, its asynchronous and it's essential to have the synchronous generation that fossil fuel and hydro plants can give. If you have too much wind input the grid becomes unstable and more difficult to keep frequency in tolerance, trips occur on the grid if it goes out of tolerance. In other words wind generation is inferior to synchronous generation and is not a simple replacement of that sort of power. It is not a good answer if you want to reduce fossil fuel generation.
There are a couple of other technical issues with wind and that is before intermittency is even considered.

Humble request: please don't use music with non-conventional time signatures as background music, it's incredibly distracting and I have trouble concentrating on the subject matter. The composer started off thinking "I'm going to do a song in 5/4 time", but as is usually the case with 5/4 songs, what came out was a 6/4 song with the sixth beat skipped, so my brain notices that beat getting skipped over and over. It's like if you decided to do an entire video without using the letter 'e', but you never pointed out that you were doing so, then expected the audience to not get distracted by the fact that you're making weird verbal choice to avoid using "the". Two things.
1. They are not windmills, they are wind turbines. They mill nothing. They are commonly referred to as WTGs, Wind Turbine Generators. Calling them windmills sounds like you're mocking them much like a recent former US President.

2. It'd be great if you added one extra tid bit about why 3 blades, not 2, not 4.
3 blades is again an optimization.
2 blades have the disadvantage of wobble. When the bottom blade passes across the tower, it is in a 'shadow' where wind can't pass (due to the tower)... this causes a wobble as the top blade experiences max force on it. In addition, to capture the same amount of power, the blades need to be much longer.
4 blades just adds cost and weight and overall makes the WTG less cost efficient.

There are also older 1 blade turbines! With a single blade and a counter-weight opposite. They were used around the equator where cyclones/hurricanes would be frequent. During extremely high winds, they stowed the blade downwards along the tower and only the stubby counter-weight was exposed.

As homework in my Computational Fluid Dynamics class, we had to determine what percentage of the wind's energy was extracted by a provided modern windmill design as we altered the number of blades. Everyone thought their results were wrong - 3 bladed windmills were notably less efficient than 4 bladed ones, which were a tiny bit less efficient than 5 bladed ones (efficiency started falling past 5 blades). If our results were correct, why did we only use 3 bladed windmills in practice?

The answer, our professor explained, was cost-benefit analysis. Sure you could get more energy out of a 4 or 5 bladed windmill, but the blades cost a lot of money. Someone determined that for the lifetime of a windmill, the cost of the 4th blade wasn't recovered by the additional energy gained, and so we only see 3 bladed ones.

I don't think that wedge example is correct. When the ball hits a moving wedge. It bounces less to the left (than if it hit a static wedge) because the the surface of the wedge is moving away from the ball, so it's as if the ball is hitting the surface at slower speed. Also, we account for friction, when the ball hits the wedge the friction between the two is going to grab the ball and pull it more to the right (taking away from its velocity to the left. In either case, the ball is is losing velocity in the left direction and every action has an equal and opposite reaction the wedge must be losing velocity in the right direction (as opposed to a static wedge being hit by a ball, it will still gain velocity when compared to not being struck at all).

All of this also ignores the higher amounts of turbulence, drag and centripetal forces the are trying to rip the turbine apart (if turbines were slower they could be made even larger and radius is a big deal in turbine design). Slower speeds are definitely more efficient (assuming you have complete freedom in your turbine design. They design them to spin faster because electric generators tend to be more efficient at higher rpm (and gear boxes are heavy, complex and expensive), AC transmits more efficiently at higher frequencies and faster designs also use thinner blades which means less material and is much easier (relatively speaking) to transport and assemble.

First one of your videos I disliked. You missed the main design constraint of modern windmills; weight. The modern design is "bad" at capturing wind energy, but that is because they are designed to be light so they can be placed higher. Power scales with the cube of wind speed, so getting it higher is top priority.

You also didn't cover the reason for 3 blade designs or why blade length is decided. They both come down to reducing the torque caused by the wind pushing the top harder than the bottom. Wear on the gearbox and bearings from uneven axial force is the main cause of failure in windmills.

I appreciate that you have to vastly simplify to get these across in a short time, but another design element that affects the design is the designed wind speed range. Lower cut-in and lower operating wind favors a higher blade count. This is why 'old west' homestead water pump windmills are multi-bladed with a 'solidity' of around 60-80%. They are optimized not for peak power, but low speed wind operation and better torque. Source: Graduate Level Wind power design course at the Technion in Haifa, Israel.

There is another benefit of faster moving turbines. When converting kinetic energy to electrical energy the power remains constant (minus some efficiency losses). Power from the rotating kinetic energy of the turbine is RPM x Torque (ft-lbs) (1 ft-lb/min = 0.023 watts). Power generated in electricity is voltage x amperage (1 volt-ampere = 1 watt). So on the electrical side you can either boost voltage or amperage to get your power and on the mechanical side you can either boost torque or speed. With most generators boosting speed is equivalent to boosting voltage meaning you can lower your amperage. On average this is more efficient as it is safer to transmit lower current and allows your electrical components (wiring, breakers, etc) to be lighter and more efficient. On large gas turbine powered generators (think jet engine powered generator) that spin at 10,000 RPM or more the internal wiring is extremely light.

Most residential power grids (in America at least) run at 15,000 to 25,000 volts for this reason, they can run at much lower amperage (if they were running lower voltage the size of the power cables would be immense, probably too large to run on the standard above ground pole you see in rural areas). They are only stepped down to the required 240 volts at the house transformer.

You are definetely wrong on 2:15. The shorter way of the ball makes after hitting the block, means the LESS energy was transfered into block's kinetic energy! It comes from law of conservation of linear momentum. Just think about it: if the ball has fallen on flat area it would stop in the spot- would it mean it gave most energy to the ground? Yes, but it didn't increased kinetic energy of flat area AT ALL! All the energy was lost - went to temperature increase. The farther the ball bounces off the more energy was transfered to block's kinetic energy! The faster the windmill spins the less distorted wind is after it passes - so windmill farms work better this way, but the faster it spins the less energy it gains from the wind.

You're missing one major rule in the speed of the blades. The tip may not exceed the speed of sound. At that point it accelerates the incoming air (and also produces a lot of noise). That limits the rotational speed. So the bigger the windmill the slower the rpm.
